intro: Baccaurea acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata baccaurea, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically red when ripe, containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
